recipes.name: Kheer (Vermicelli Pudding)
method: Heat ghee in a pan and roast the vermicelli until golden brown.
In a separate pot, bring the milk to a boil.
Add the roasted vermicelli to the boiling milk and cook until it softens.
Add sugar and stir until it dissolves completely.
Add cardamom powder, nuts, and raisins.
Cook for a few more minutes until the mixture thickens slightly.
Serve warm or chilled.

recipes.name: Rice Flour Pudding
method: Mix rice flour with a small amount of milk to make a smooth paste.
Boil the remaining milk in a pot.
Slowly add the rice flour paste to the boiling milk while stirring continuously.
Add sugar and stir until it dissolves.
Cook on low heat until the mixture thickens.
Add cardamom powder and chopped nuts.
Serve warm or cold.

recipes.name: Besan Burfi
method: Heat ghee in a pan and add the besan.
Roast the besan on low heat until it turns golden brown and aromatic.
In a separate pan, dissolve the sugar in water and bring it to a boil to make a syrup.
Add the sugar syrup to the roasted besan and mix well.
Cook for a few more minutes until the mixture thickens.
Add cardamom powder and chopped nuts.
Pour the mixture into a greased tray and let it set.
Cut into squares and serve.

recipes.name: Kheer
method: Wash the rice and soak it for 30 minutes.
In a pot, boil the milk and add the soaked rice.
Cook on low heat until the rice is soft and the mixture thickens.
Add sugar and stir until it dissolves.
Add cardamom powder, chopped nuts, and raisins.
Cook for a few more minutes until the kheer thickens.
Serve warm or chilled.

recipes.name: Gulab Jamuns (Easy Method)

ingredients.ingredient: as needed to make the dough

method: Mix milk powder, flour, baking powder, and ghee. Add milk to form a soft dough.
Divide the dough into small balls and set aside.
In a pan, dissolve sugar in water and bring it to a boil to make the syrup.
Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the balls on low heat until golden brown.
Soak the fried balls in the warm sugar syrup.
Add cardamom powder to the syrup.
Serve warm.

recipes.name: Suji Halva (Semolina Halva)
method: Heat ghee in a pan and roast the semolina until golden brown.
In another pot, boil water and sugar together to make a syrup.
Gradually add the sugar syrup to the roasted semolina while stirring continuously.
Cook until the mixture thickens and leaves the sides of the pan.
Add cardamom powder, chopped nuts, and raisins.
Mix well and serve warm.

recipes.name: Sewian (Vermicelli)
method: Heat ghee in a pan and roast the vermicelli until golden brown.
Add milk and bring to a boil.
Cook on low heat until the vermicelli is soft.
Add sugar and stir until it dissolves.
Add cardamom powder, chopped nuts, and raisins.
Cook for a few more minutes.
Serve warm or chilled.

recipes.name: Carrot Halva
method: Heat ghee in a pan and add the grated carrots.
Cook on medium heat until the carrots are soft.
Add milk and cook until the mixture thickens and the milk is absorbed.
Add sugar and stir until it dissolves.
Add cardamom powder, chopped nuts, and raisins.
Cook until the mixture leaves the sides of the pan.
Serve warm.

recipes.name: Rasgoola
method: Boil the milk and add lemon juice to curdle it.
Strain the curdled milk through a muslin cloth to separate the whey.
Knead the resulting paneer until smooth.
Form small balls from the kneaded paneer.
In a pan, dissolve sugar in water and bring to a boil.
Add the paneer balls to the boiling syrup and cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes.
Serve the rasgoolas in the syrup once cooled.

recipes.name: Mango Ice Cream
method: In a bowl, mix the mango puree, heavy cream, and condensed milk until smooth.
Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Alternatively, pour the mixture into a container and freeze for 4-6 hours, stirring every hour to break up ice crystals.
Serve the mango ice cream cold.
